sense.def:
A tune
je niz tonov, ki je prijeten in si ga zlahka zapomnimo. V glasbenih delih se včasih večkrat ponovi.

seg.quote: The orchestra was playing a selection of tunes from The Merry Widow.

sense.def:
To tune a musical instrument
pomeni prilagoditi glasbeni inštrument, tako da bo spet oddajal prave tone.

To tune an engine or machine
pomeni prilagoditi motor ali stroj tako, da bo dobro delal.

seg.quote: I told her the car needed tuning.

sense.def:
Kadar radijski ali televizijski sprejemnik
is tuned to a particular broadcasting station
, je nastavljen tako, da lahko poslušamo ali gledamo oddaje določene radijske ali televizijske postaje.

seg.quote: Stay tuned to Radio Desland for a further announcement.

sense.def:
Kadar je glasbilo
in tune
, daje prave tone.

To be in tune with a group of people
pomeni strinjati se ali sočustvovati z neko skupino ljudi.

seg.quote: His ideas are in tune with the spirit of his age.

sense.def:
To change one's tune
pomeni govoriti ali delati drugače kot prej.

seg.quote: He soon changed his tune and started working as hard as the others.

sense.def:
To the tune of a particular amount
pomeni v obsegu določenega zneska ali količine;

seg.quote: The university subsidises its students to the tune of £100,000 a year.

sense.def:
To tune in to a radio station
pomeni naravnati radijski sprejemnik tako, da lahko poslušamo program določene radijske postaje.

seg.quote: He turned the dial and tuned in to Radio Paris.

sense.def:
Kadar skupina glasbenikov
tunes up
, svoje inštrumente prilagodi tako, da dajejo prave tone.

seg.quote: The orchestra was tuning up for its regular Sunday afternoon broadcast.
